title: Nenggiri polls: Umno lodges police report against Muhyiddin for allegedly touching on 3R issues
summary: The Youth and Puteri wings of the Pekan division of Umno filed a police report on Saturday against Perikatan Nasional chairman Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin for allegedly touching on sensitive issues related to race, religion and royalty (3R) during the Nenggiri by-election campaign.
content:
PEKAN (Aug 17): The Youth and Puteri wings of the Pekan division of Umno filed a police report on Saturday against Perikatan Nasional chairman Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin for allegedly touching on sensitive issues related to race, religion and royalty (3R) during the Nenggiri by-election campaign.

The division’s Umno Youth head, Mohd Fakhrul Akhmal Mohamed, claimed that during his campaign speeches, Muhyiddin purportedly made statements regarding the authority of Sultan of Pahang Al-Sultan Abd

title: BN recaptures Nenggiri state seat with 3,352-vote majority
summary:
Barisan Nasional (BN) recaptured the Nenggiri state seat when its candidate Mohd Azmawi Fikri Abdul Ghani won by a majority of 3,352 votes in Saturday's by-election.

The Kelantan Umno Youth chief polled 9,091 votes to beat PAS candidate Mohd Rizwadi Ismail, representing Perikatan Nasional (PN), who obtained 5,739 votes.
content:
GUA MUSANG (Aug 17): Barisan Nasional (BN) recaptured the Nenggiri state seat when its candidate Mohd Azmawi Fikri Abdul Ghani won by a majority of 3,352 votes in Saturday's by-election.

The Kelantan Umno Youth chief polled 9,091 votes to beat PAS candidate Mohd Rizwadi Ismail, representing Perikatan Nasional (PN), who obtained 5,739 votes.

The results were announced by returning officer Nik Raisnan Daud at the vote-t

title: Policy to improve fiscal position, Madani Economy framework boosting investor confidence, says Amir Hamzah
summary: The policy of improving the country’s fiscal position and the Madani Economy framework have boosted foreign investors’ confidence to continue investing in Malaysia, said Finance Minister II Datuk Seri Amir Hamzah Azizan.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (Aug 17): The policy of improving the country’s fiscal position and the Madani Economy framework have boosted foreign investors’ confidence to continue investing in Malaysia, said Finance Minister II Datuk Seri Amir Hamzah Azizan. 

He said this was reflected in the 5.9% year-on-year gross domestic product growth posted for the second quarter of this year, compared with the initial projection of 5.8%.

"When we have a clear Madani Economy&nbs

title: Polling ends, vote-counting commences for Nenggiri state by-election
summary:
Polling for the Nenggiri state by-election on Saturday concluded after all 20 polling stations, which were opened at 8am, closed by 6pm.

Fourteen polling stations closed at 6pm, while six closed earlier — four of them at 2pm and the other two at 3pm.
content:
GUA MUSANG (Aug 17): Polling for the Nenggiri state by-election on Saturday concluded after all 20 polling stations, which were opened at 8am, closed by 6pm.

Fourteen polling stations closed at 6pm, while six closed earlier — four of them at 2pm and the other two at 3pm.

Immediately after the polling stations closed, all ballot boxes from 46 voting channels were transported to the official vote-tallying centre at Dewan Perdana, Komp

title: Take immediate action if there is civil service negligence, says PM
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has asked Chief Secretary to the Government (KSN) Datuk Seri Shamsul Azri Abu Bakar and Public Service Department director general (KPPA) Datuk Seri Wan Ahmad Dahlan Abdul Aziz to take immediate action if there are negligence and weaknesses in the public service system.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (Aug 17): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has asked Chief Secretary to the Government (KSN) Datuk Seri Shamsul Azri Abu Bakar and Public Service Department director general (KPPA) Datuk Seri Wan Ahmad Dahlan Abdul Aziz to take immediate action if there are negligence and weaknesses in the public service system.

He said that the move is necessary to ensure that the good name of public servants is defended, in addition to improving their performance in line with the public service r

title: RHB revises upward forecast for Malaysia's 2024 GDP growth to 5%
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: RHB Bank Bhd has revised its forecast for Malaysia's gross domestic product (GDP) growth in 2024 to 5.0 per cent year-on-year (y-o-y) from 4.6 per cent previously amid the growth acceleration in the second quarter (2Q) of 2024.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: RHB Bank Bhd has revised its forecast for Malaysia's gross domestic product (GDP) growth in 2024 to 5.0 per cent year-on-year (y-o-y) from 4.6 per cent previously amid the growth acceleration in the second quarter (2Q) of 2024.

The bank said the catalyst for the upgrade was based on three key factors, namely stronger-than-expected 2Q 2024 GDP growth at 5.9 per cent, the expectation that GDP growth would remain robust at 4.9 per cent in the second half of 2024,

title: PM Anwar: Strengthen domestic economy to mitigate effects from external challenges
summary: JOHOR BAHRU: Malaysia must enhance its economic foundation and strengthen its resilience to shield the nation from the ripple effects of external forces, including geopolitical tensions, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

JOHOR BAHRU: Malaysia must enhance its economic foundation and strengthen its resilience to shield the nation from the ripple effects of external forces, including geopolitical tensions, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

He said while the government's MADANI Economic Framework is carefully designed to ensure the smooth execution of its plans, some exposure to global factors remains unavoidable.

title: Ringgit seen hovering around current level next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to stay at the current levels of 4.43 to 4.45 against the greenback next week amid caution as a series of US Federal Reserve (Fed) officials will speak publicly on the American economy.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to stay at the current levels of 4.43 to 4.45 against the greenback next week amid caution as a series of US Federal Reserve (Fed) officials will speak publicly on the American economy.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said the market spotlight will be on Fed chairman Jerome Powell's speech during the Jackson Hole Symposium next Friday.

"At the current juncture, all data point to an eventual

title: Mpox: France on high alert, South Korea ramps up control measures
summary:
French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal announced on Saturday that the French health system is on "high alert" in response to the mpox outbreak.

Attal chaired a crisis cell meeting on Saturday evening, which included representatives from the relevant ministries, according to the Emirates News Agency.
content:
PARIS (Aug 17): French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal announced on Saturday that the French health system is on "high alert" in response to the mpox outbreak.

Attal chaired a crisis cell meeting on Saturday evening, which included representatives from the relevant ministries, according to the Emirates News Agency (WAP).

In South Korea, the Yonhap News Agency reported that authorities are ramping up quarantine and surveillance measur

title: Claims of dropping PKR leader from Cabinet an old tactic of opposition, says Rafizi
summary:
Economy Minister Mohd Rafizi Ramli described rumours about a PKR top leader being dropped from the Cabinet as an outdated opposition tactic.

Rafizi, who is also the PKR deputy president, said the opposition had been playing up petty issues as they are not able to discuss matters related to national interests, such as the economy and administration.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (Aug 17): Economy Minister Mohd Rafizi Ramli described rumours about a PKR top leader being dropped from the Cabinet as an outdated opposition tactic.

Rafizi, who is also the PKR deputy president, said the opposition had been playing up petty issues as they are not able to discuss matters related to national interests, such as the economy and administration.

"It’s a lie...I think this is an outdated tactic on politi

title: Firing on all cylinders
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Standard Chartered (StanChart) has maintained its forecast for Malaysia’s gross domestic product (GDP) growth at 4.8% for 2024, while acknowledging upside risks.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Standard Chartered (StanChart) has maintained its forecast for Malaysia’s gross domestic product (GDP) growth at 4.8% for 2024, while acknowledging upside risks.

“We see consumer spending moderating as labour-market conditions soften but expect it to remain the primary driver. Investment should continue to benefit from ongoing infrastructure projects, strong foreign direct investment (FDI) interest and lower global interest rates,” StanChart economist Jonathan

title: New minimum wage proposal to be presented to Cabinet next month — HR minister
summary:
The proposal for a new minimum wage is expected to be presented in a Cabinet meeting next month, said Human Resources Minister Steven Sim Chee Keong.

He said the Ministry of Human Resources had received a report and recommendations on the new minimum wage rate from the National Wages Consultative Council chaired by Tan Sri Zainal Rahim Seman.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Aug 17): The proposal for a new minimum wage is expected to be presented in a Cabinet meeting next month, said Human Resources Minister Steven Sim Chee Keong.

He said the Ministry of Human Resources had received a report and recommendations on the new minimum wage rate from the National Wages Consultative Council chaired by Tan Sri Zainal Rahim Seman.

Sim said the ministry had distributed a Cabinet paper to the relevant minist

title: Nenggiri by-election: Police receive 18 reports, open six investigation papers
summary:
The police have received 18 reports, and opened six investigation papers related to the Nenggiri state by-election since Friday.

Kelantan police chief Datuk Muhamad Zaki Harun said the six cases are being investigated under Section 4A of the Election Offences Act 1954, Section 233 of the Communications and Multimedia Act, and Section 505 (b) of the Penal Code.
content:
GUA MUSANG (Aug 17): The police have received 18 reports, and opened six investigation papers related to the Nenggiri state by-election since Friday.

Kelantan police chief Datuk Muhamad Zaki Harun said the six cases are being investigated under Section 4A of the Election Offences Act 1954, Section 233 of the Communications and Multimedia Act, and Section 505 (b) of the Penal Code.

Additionally, he said that another 12 reports are isolated cases.</

title: Anwar disappointed by backlash against effort to bring in injured Palestinians for treatment
summary:
Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Saturday expressed disappointment and sadness over the backlash from some parties against the government’s move to bring injured Palestinians from Gaza to receive medical treatment in Malaysia.

He said some even went to extremes in criticising the noble effort, when it was a small act of compassion and kindness towards the Palestinian people who had been suffering and enduring Israel’s genocidal acts in Gaza.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (Aug 17): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Saturday expressed disappointment and sadness over the backlash from some parties against the government’s move to bring injured Palestinians from Gaza to receive medical treatment in Malaysia.

He said some even went to extremes in criticising the noble effort, when it was a small act of compassion and kindness towards the Palestinian people who had been suffering and enduring Israel’s genocidal acts in Gaza.

title: Rafizi: 2Q growth of 5.9% shows investor confidence in Malaysia's economic potential
summary: Malaysia’s rapid economic growth in the second quarter of 2024 (2Q2024), at 5.9% and above expectations, reflected the confidence of foreign investors in the country's potential, said Economy Minister Mohd Rafizi Ramli.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (Aug 17): Malaysia’s rapid economic growth in the second quarter of 2024 (2Q2024), at 5.9% and above expectations, reflected the confidence of foreign investors in the country's potential, said Economy Minister Mohd Rafizi Ramli.

He said this shows that the government’s policies and economic growth narratives had been well received. Therefore, Rafizi said the government needs to continue the growth momentum by intensifying its efforts to attract investors to maintain the international confiden

title: BN to contest Mahkota state seat, says PH's Saifuddin
summary:
Pakatan Harapan (PH) is not fielding a candidate to contest the Mahkota state seat in Johor next month.

PH secretary general Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail said the matter was agreed upon in a top leadership meeting chaired by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim last week.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 17): Pakatan Harapan (PH) is not fielding a candidate to contest the Mahkota state seat in Johor next month.

PH secretary general Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail said the matter was agreed upon in a top leadership meeting chaired by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim last week.

It was agreed that Barisan Nasional's (BN) candidate would contest the seat out of respect for the principle of incumbency that was practised by

title: My Say: Technology and innovation will help us live longer
summary:
Across the world, the average life expectancy is now 73 years old — more than double what it was 200 years ago. The good news is this: Malaysians have a slight edge as our average mortality is now 75 years, up from 72 some 20 years ago.

What has led to this positive trajectory, and what...
content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on August 12, 2024 - August 18, 2024

Across the world, the average life expectancy is now 73 years old — more than double what it was 200 years ago. The good news is this: Malaysians have a slight edge as our average mortality is now 75 years, up from 72 some 20 years ago.

What has led to this positive trajectory, and what will it take to keep edging it upwards?

title: Govt advised to monitor prices of goods following salary adjustment for civil servants
summary: The government needs to monitor and control prices of goods and raw materials to avoid manipulation by irresponsible parties, following the salary adjustment for civil servants announced on Friday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 17): The government needs to monitor and control prices of goods and raw materials to avoid manipulation by irresponsible parties, following the salary adjustment for civil servants announced on Friday.

Former Congress of the Union of Employees in the Public and Civil Services (Cuepacs) president Datuk Azih Muda said the announcement of the salary adjustment had raised concern in society about a potential increase in prices of goods, unless the government takes measures to prevent it.

title: Govt measures could balance fiscal poser arising from civil service salary rise, says don
summary: The planned salary increment for Malaysia's 1.6 million civil servants is a fiscal challenge that is not insurmountable, and could be balanced by the government’s strategic measures.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 17): The planned salary increment for Malaysia's 1.6 million civil servants is a fiscal challenge that is not insurmountable, and could be balanced by the government’s strategic measures.

The overall fiscal outlook remains manageable, said Universiti Malaya’s Business and Economics Faculty Deputy Dean (Development) Dr Goh Lim Thye.

Goh said while the increments are necessary to address the lower public-sector salaries versus the priva

title: MBSB — a growing bank with an appetite for M&A
summary: MBSB Bhd’s (KL:MBSB) merger with Malaysian Industrial Development Finance Bhd just over 10 months ago helped solidify its position as the country’s second-largest stand-alone Islamic bank by assets after Bank Islam Malaysia Bhd (KL:BIMB).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 17): MBSB Bhd’s (KL:MBSB) merger with Malaysian Industrial Development Finance Bhd just over 10 months ago helped solidify its position as the country’s second-largest stand-alone Islamic bank by assets after Bank Islam Malaysia Bhd (KL:BIMB).

Yet, it remains a relatively small player in a highly competitive and crowded market, where net profit margins have been on the decline — a fact that is not lost on its key shareholders. MBSB is 57.45% owned by the Employees Provident Fund (EPF), and 12

title: My Say: Southeast Asia needs to build climate-resilient energy systems
summary:
On July 21 and 22, Earth experienced the two hottest days on record. This was only two months after the extended heat wave in May that hit many parts of Southeast Asia in the Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam, with temperatures reaching well above 40°C.

As Southeast Asia is one of the r...
content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on August 12, 2024 - August 18, 2024

On July 21 and 22, Earth experienced the two hottest days on record. This was only two months after the extended heat wave in May that hit many parts of Southeast Asia in the Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam, with temperatures reaching well above 40°C.

title: Malaysia supports policy guidance on Low Carbon Hydrogen Framework, says Fadillah
summary: The 14th Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Energy Ministerial Meeting has concluded with economic partners supporting the launch of the APEC Policy Guidance to develop and implement a Low Carbon Hydrogen Policy Framework in the Asia-Pacific.
content:
LIMA, Peru (Aug 17): The 14th Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Energy Ministerial Meeting has concluded with economic partners supporting the launch of the APEC Policy Guidance to develop and implement a Low Carbon Hydrogen Policy Framework in the Asia-Pacific.

This policy guide provides a solid framework of reference for APEC economies to develop a comprehensive and effective hydrogen strategy.

title: Asian utility stocks have never had it so good in two decades
summary:
Utilities stocks have emerged as an unlikely favourite of investors in Asia, and bets are growing that their standout rally this year has further to go.

Powering the sector’s boom after two years of losses are supportive local policies and the frenzy surrounding artificial intelligence (AI), which is causing a dramatic increase in electricity demand in many parts of the world. As concerns grow about a potential global economic slowdown and rising geopolitical tensions, utilities firms’ high dividend payouts and the defensive nature of their stocks are also being touted as tailwinds.
content:
(Aug 17): Utilities stocks have emerged as an unlikely favourite of investors in Asia, and bets are growing that their standout rally this year has further to go.

Powering the sector’s boom after two years of losses are supportive local policies and the frenzy surrounding artificial intelligence (AI), which is causing a dramatic increase in electricity demand in many parts of the world. title: StanChart maintains Malaysia's GDP growth at 4.8%, ringgit to hit 4.66
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Standard Chartered (StanChart) has maintained Malaysia’s gross domestic product (GDP) growth for 2024 at 4.8%, in line with Bank Negara Malaysia’s projection of 4% to 5%.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Standard Chartered (StanChart) has maintained Malaysia’s gross domestic product (GDP) growth for 2024 at 4.8%, in line with Bank Negara Malaysia’s projection of 4% to 5%.

Head of managed investments and advisory in Malaysia Ng Shin Seong said this projection, however, has not taken into consideration the future measures on subsidy rationalisation.

“On the fuel subsidy (diesel), we think it is a very targeted approach, ensuring

title: The Week Ahead: Trade and inflation data, EPB’s IPO debut in focus
summary: Malaysia kicks things off on Monday with the release of July’s external trade numbers, where UOB Global Economics and Markets Research is expecting exports to show stronger growth momentum of 8.5% year on year (y-o-y) from the previous month’s 1.7% y-o-y increase.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on August 19, 2024 - August 25, 2024

Malaysia kicks things off on Monday with the release of July’s external trade numbers, where UOB Global Economics and Markets Research is expecting exports to show stronger growth momentum of 8.5% year on year (y-o-y) from the previous month’s 1.7% y-o-y increase.

title: Police uncover 'Pantheon Ventures' investment scam with RM14.9m in losses
summary:
Police have uncovered an investment scam known as 'Pantheon Ventures' being actively promoted on Facebook and Instagram.

Bukit Aman Commercial Crime Investigation Department director Datuk Seri Ramli Mohamed Yoosuf stated that investigations revealed that the scheme falsely claims to offer investments tied to the stock markets of Malaysia, Taiwan, and China.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 16): Police have uncovered an investment scam known as 'Pantheon Ventures' being actively promoted on Facebook and Instagram.

Bukit Aman Commercial Crime Investigation Department director Datuk Seri Ramli Mohamed Yoosuf stated that investigations revealed that the scheme falsely claims to offer investments tied to the stock markets of Malaysia, Taiwan, and China.

He said the promised returns range from 8% to 23%, depending o

title: Nenggiri by-election: 20 polling stations open at 8am, results expected at 9pm at the earliest
summary:
Twenty polling stations with 46 channels opened simultaneously at 8am on Saturday for the Nenggiri state by-election.

According to the Meteorological Department, fine weather is forecast for the morning, and this condition is expected to continue until 6pm when the polling stations are closed.
content:
GUA MUSANG (Aug 17): Twenty polling stations with 46 channels opened simultaneously at 8am on Saturday for the Nenggiri state by-election.

According to the Meteorological Department, fine weather is forecast for the morning, and this condition is expected to continue until 6pm when the polling stations are closed.

The two candidates in the by-election, namely Barisan Nasional candidate Mohd Azmawi Fikri Abdul Ghani representing the unity government and PAS

title: Kim Dotcom vows to fight order for US extradition
summary: AFPNew Zealand-based tech entrepreneur Kim Dotcom lashed out at the US government Friday, as his decade-long effort to avoid extradition on fraud and money laundering charges appeared to have failed.Local media reported Thursday that New Zealand's justice minister ...
content:
AFP

New Zealand-based tech entrepreneur Kim Dotcom lashed out at the US government Friday, as his decade-long effort to avoid extradition on fraud and money laundering charges appeared to have failed.

Local media reported Thursday that New Zealand's justice minister had signed an order to extradite Dotcom, the founder of the Megaupload file-sharing system.

He faces charges including fraud, money laundering and racketeering, punishable with up to 20 years in jail. 

Dotcom has long fought extradition while

title: Indonesia leader touts economic success in final state address
summary: Indonesian President Joko Widodo hailed his economic track record on Friday in a final state of the nation address before he leaves office in October after a decade in power.Widodo, more popularly known as Jokowi, will be replaced by ...
content:
Indonesian President Joko Widodo hailed his economic track record on Friday in a final state of the nation address before he leaves office in October after a decade in power.

Widodo, more popularly known as Jokowi, will be replaced by defence chief Prabowo Subianto after serving the maximum two terms, with more than three-quarters of Indonesians approving of his rule in recent opinion polls.

He will leave office with an economic legacy of consistent growth of about five percent and large infrastructure projects including

title: China, Vietnam eye boost to rail links as top leaders meet
summary: HANOI: Rail links will be high on the agenda when Vietnam's newly appointed leader To Lam travels to China to meet President Xi Jinping next week, officials said, as the neighbours seek to boost trade.Seamless rail links are ...
content:
HANOI: Rail links will be high on the agenda when Vietnam's newly appointed leader To Lam travels to China to meet President Xi Jinping next week, officials said, as the neighbours seek to boost trade.

Seamless rail links are seen as crucial for supply chains, as a growing number of Chinese manufacturers move some export-oriented operations to Vietnam amid trade tensions between China and the United States.

The countries are connected by two railways from Southern China to Vietnam's capital Hanoi and its norther

title: 'Buy' rating on Sunway REIT stays
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Sunway Real Estate Investment Trust (Sunway Reit) is expected to sustain its earnings in the near to medium term.Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB) said this will be underpinned by positive portfolio rental reversions, stronger retail spending, ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Sunway Real Estate Investment Trust (Sunway Reit) is expected to sustain its earnings in the near to medium term.

Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB) said this will be underpinned by positive portfolio rental reversions, stronger retail spending, higher tourist arrivals and the company's three ongoing acquisitions.

Sunway Reit has three ongoing acquisitions, namely an industrial property in Prai, Penang; 163 Retail Park in Mont Kiara; and Kluang Mall in Johor, all of which are expected to be completed

title: Sustained growth momentum
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's economy may sustain its momentum after surprising the market with a faster-than-expected growth of 5.9 per cent in the second quarter (Q2) of 2024.Economists said the latest gross domestic product (GDP) figure represents the strongest growth since ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's economy may sustain its momentum after surprising the market with a faster-than-expected growth of 5.9 per cent in the second quarter (Q2) of 2024.

Economists said the latest gross domestic product (GDP) figure represents the strongest growth since Q4 2022, beating official estimates. 

The Department of Statistics Malaysia had previously released an advance estimate of 5.8 per cent GDP growth for Q2 2024. 

Bank Negara Malaysia governor Datuk Seri Abdul Rasheed Ghaffour said private cons

title: Wall St Week Ahead: 'Soft landing' hopes set to lift US stocks
summary: Hopes for an economic soft landing are once again powering US stocks higher, as encouraging data relieve recession worries following a brutal sell-off earlier this month.
content:
A rapid return to calm was also evident in the Cboe Volatility Index, or Wall Street's "fear gauge," which has retreated from last week’s four-year highs at a record pace. — AFP

NEW YORK: Hopes for an economic soft landing are once again powering US stocks higher, as encouraging data relieve recession worries following a brutal sell-off earlier this month.

title: Wall St ends on high note as recession fears fade
summary: US stocks ended higher on Friday, extending their biggest weekly percentage gains of the year as worries of an economic downturn eased and investors focused on the Jackson Hole Economic Symposium next week.
content:
The Dow rose 96.7 points, or 0.24%, to 40,659.76. The S&P 500 gained 11.03 points, or 0.20%, at 5,554.25 and the Nasdaq added 37.22 points, or 0.21%, at 17,631.72.

title: Oil prices fall 2% on China demand concerns
summary: Oil prices settled down nearly 2% on Friday, little changed on the week with Brent crude below US$80 a barrel, as investors tempered expectations of demand growth from top oil importer China.
content:
Brent crude futures fell US$1.36, or 1.7%, to settle at US$79.68 per barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude futures declined by US$1.51, or 1.9%, to US$76.65.

NEW YORK: Oil prices settled down nearly 2% on Friday, little changed on the week with Brent crude below US$80 a barrel, as investors tempered expectations of demand growth from top oil importer China.

Brent crude futures fell US$1.36, or 1.7%, to

title: CAAM to publish new rules on foreign-registered aircraft by end-2024
summary: Technical aviation regulator Civil Aviation Authority of Malaysia (CAAM) has commenced a comprehensive review on regulation 147 of the Civil Aviation Regulations 2016, which pertains to the operation of foreign-registered aircraft in general aviation.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 17): Technical aviation regulator Civil Aviation Authority of Malaysia (CAAM) has commenced a comprehensive review on regulation 147 of the Civil Aviation Regulations 2016, which pertains to the operation of foreign-registered aircraft in general aviation.

In a statement issued late Friday night, CAAM chief executive officer Datuk Captain Norazman Mahmud said the review aims to empower CAAM with improved oversight capabilities regarding foreign-registered aircraft operating within Malaysia.</

title: Strong momentum expected to continue in second half of 2024
summary: PETALING JAYA: Malaysia’s economy is expected to maintain its strong growth into the second half of 2024 (2H24), with a chance of exceeding projections despite potential global headwinds, say experts.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Malaysia’s economy is expected to maintain its strong growth into the second half of 2024 (2H24), with a chance of exceeding projections despite potential global headwinds, say experts.

The resilience shown in 1H24, particularly the 5.9% growth in the second quarter, suggests the momentum to carry forward, albeit at a more moderate pace.

Sunway University economics professor Dr Yeah Kim Leng said while quarter-on-quarter growth in gross domestic product

title: GDP growth rises to 5.9% in Q2
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia’s economy continues to show resi­lience as domestic demand rose, investment flowed through, and exports expanded in the second quarter of this year.
content:
Uptick: Abdul Rasheed (right) with chief statistician Datuk Mohd Uzir Mahidin after the release of the second quarter GDP results. — ONG SOON HIN/The Star

KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia’s economy continues to show resilience as domestic demand rose, investment flowed through, and exports expanded in the second quarter of this year.

This resulted in the gross domestic product (GDP) growing by 5.9% in the three months to June 2024 compared with a growth of 4.2% i

title: The EV experience
summary: High purchase prices top the list of reasons preventing sceptics from considering electric vehicles (EVs) in addition to insufficient driving range and the cars’ battery life.
content:
HIGH purchase prices top the list of reasons preventing sceptics from considering electric vehicles (EVs) in addition to insufficient driving range and the cars’ battery life.

Other concerns include electricity prices and the availability of public charging infrastructure.

Surprisingly, sustainability has a minor influence on purchase decisions.

These are some of the findings of a recent survey by McKinsey & Co’s Mobility Consumer Pulse. A total of 15,034 ind

title: Sustained earnings momentum on the cards
summary: The current financial reporting season is expected to see some commendable performances from property developers, amid the improving business environment and better economic conditions.
content:
Buoyant sentiment: A view of the Kuala Lumpur skyline. Loan applications for property transactions have increased in April, May and June. — Reuters

THE current financial reporting season is expected to see some commendable performances from property developers, amid the improving business environment and better economic conditions.
